channel.title: No path specified?
channel.description: i changed all the stuff in the client.java file but when i go to compile, it says "the system cannot find the path specified"? but i have all the java's downloaded like jdk n etc.. im so lost. :o

item.title: No path specified?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“play 4 fun, post:8, topic:394334”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=491520.msg3594344#msg3594344 date=1304922124]

im not high? wtf do i care about sounding stupid on the internet? its the fuckin internet. idgaf lmao… im dumass hi and lazy. i dont feel like going thru all that… wth is ur problem lolz got nothing better to do so u sit on this 24/7 making smart remarks >.>

If you don’t “feel like going thru all that” when you’re simply setting some environment variables, you will obviously get no where here, and frequently be ridiculed.

[/quote]

i was talking about having to go thru all the threads just to find that when people can help me directly…
-and its wierd. i did all that and set it, but i stil have the same problem with it saying the same thing. i downloaded the newest java w/ netbeans too and did everything in the tutorial but same prob… this sux. i wonder if itz cuz im on a laptop?[/quote]

No.

-and its wierd. i did all that and set it, but i stil have the same problem with it saying the same thing. i downloaded the newest java w/ netbeans too and did everything in the tutorial but same prob… this sux. i wonder if itz cuz im on a laptop?

item.title: No path specified?
item.dc:creator: @Dj_Nm.E Dj Nm.E
item.description:
@Dj_Nm.E wrote:

on your compiler is it set to the right type of java you have?
(eg) jdk1.6.0_24 or jdk1.6.0_23 ect.

hopefully thats your problem

item.title: No path specified?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

play 4 fun:

uhh… aha im hella hi right now. ima go look for that on youtube now. thanks for the help

You’re not “high”. You just don’t want to sound stupid by posting further.

This question has been asked, and answered many times in the past.

There’s a sticky in this section, and a tutorial on how to fix it in the tutorials section.

item.title: No path specified?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

play 4 fun:

i changed all the stuff in the client.java file but when i go to compile, it says “the system cannot find the path specified”? but i have all the java’s downloaded like jdk n etc… im so lost. :o

You have to set your environment variables. There’s a tutorial for it. You can use the search bar to find it, or go to the appropriate section.
